text:
What does it mean to use `Symbol` type in `struct` or `Dict`  key? I am trying to understand how is it different (and better?) than just using, say, a string literal?

Eg
```struct MyStruct
  value: Symbol
end```

elements.text: What does it mean to use

key? I am trying to understand how is it different (and better?) than just using, say, a string literal?

Eg

text: Using symbols is faster, but it's really dependent on what you're trying to do. The speed won't generally be an issue for dictionaries

elements.text: Using symbols is faster, but it's really dependent on what you're trying to do. The speed won't generally be an issue for dictionaries

text: it might. I think `Symbol`s might be hashed by object ID, which will be faster than a character based hash

elements.text: s might be hashed by object ID, which will be faster than a character based hash

text: If you have a known set of keys that you, the programmer, are using then symbols can be better. Otherwise strings can be better. But that should only be an issue with seriously large dicts or really hot ones right <@U0179G7FG4F>?

elements.text: If you have a known set of keys that you, the programmer, are using then symbols can be better. Otherwise strings can be better. But that should only be an issue with seriously large dicts or really hot ones right
